fields.description:
In the new issue view, at smaller widths, we have duplicate icons for linking the issue URL (when hovering over the issue key) and for linking an issue (which doesn't also include the text depending on the width of the window).

It'd be nice to have some differentiation here since it can be a bit confusing if the accompanying text isn't present.

!Screen Shot 2020-08-05 at 11.43.24 AM.png|thumbnail!  
!Screen Shot 2020-08-05 at 11.43.58 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Consider Different Link/Attach Icons

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the new issue view, when adding images to a comment or to the issue's description, the images are located one below the other. It's not possible to adjust this in order for them to be organized side by side as it's possible in the old issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Access an issue through the new issue view
 2) Add two or more images on it. 
 3) They will be organized one below the other. It's not possible to adjust them to be shown side-by-side.
h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to organize the images for them to be shown side-by-side. This is currently possible on old issue view:

!image-2020-08-05-13-42-00-556.png!
h3. Actual Results

The images are shown one below another:
 !image-2020-08-05-13-41-38-088.png|width=271,height=350!
h3. Workaround

Disable the new issue view on Jira Labs on _Personal Settings_:

!image-2020-08-05-13-46-09-879.png|width=508,height=184!
fields.summary: Ability to locate images side-by-side on new issue view

fields.description: Availability to generate a Report from User Management with information of the users that do not have enabled 2FA
fields.summary: Availability to generate a Report from User Management with information of the users that do not have enabled 2FA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the [Configuring JIRA Cloud to send emails on behalf of your domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=979428371] only applicable on the project level. There are not site level configuration to set the domain as the sender.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement site level settings on customize the domain of the sender.
fields.summary: Send on Behalf of Your Domain feature on the site-level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to filter EPIC's child issues with basic search.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

!image-2020-08-03-13-20-12-365.png|width=479,height=233!

As per screenshot we can only retrieve EPICs and not their child issues.
h3. Expected Results

Should retrieve child issues in basic search itself and not JQL
h3. Actual Results

Only EPICs will be retrieved.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to filter EPIC's child in basic search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira does not redirect logged in users to Identity in some circumstances, even if the use does not have product access to Jira Core, JSW or JSD. These users are left to view a blank Jira dashboard when they visit sitename.atlassian.net.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure the landing page for a site is set to 'Jira' - https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html
 # Log into your Atlassian account
 # Visit sitename.atlassian.com
 # The user lands on the Jira dashboard

h3. Expected Results

Option 1. The user is redirected to Identity to either Request Access to Jira core/JSW/JSD.

Option 2. The user is redirected to start.atlassian.com

Option 3. The user is redirected to another product on the site that they have access to

Option 4. Open to other options...
h3. Actual Results

The user is left on a blank Jira dashboard, with no ability to get access and generally speaking confused as to where they are...
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a user visits sitename.atlassian.com and they do not have access to any Jira products they still have access to the Jira Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exported csv filter file name will be default (Jira.csv) if the filter is updated with complex JQL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new filter with simple JQL (ie. project = ABC)
 # Save it and name it "Test Filter"
 # Export > CSV (current field)
 ** The exported csv file name would be "Test Filter.csv" (/)
 # Modify the filter and add something like
{noformat}
project = ABC AND status not in (<Add a few statuses here, at least 3 of them>) OR priority in (<Add a few priorities here, at least 3 of them>) OR "<Any custom field>" is not EMPTY
{noformat}

 # Search > Save > Export to CSV (current field)

h3. Expected Results

Filter is saved and the exported csv file name is the same as the saved Filter name ("Test Filter.csv").
h3. Actual Results
 * After saving the JQL changes on the filter, there is a successful message in the top right. But the *Save* button is still shown as *Save* (it should be *Save As*) (x)
 ** _The filter "Test Filter" has been successfully saved._
 * When we export this to CSV (or even HTML), it will use the default naming (Jira.csv) (x)
 * If we manually accessing the filter UR (or clicking it from the left sidebar), the JQL changes is actually saved and if we export it to csv, it would use the Filter name as the exported csv file name. (/)
 ** https://<URL>.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=<Filter ID>

h3. Workaround

Manually clicking the Filter from the sidebar or, enter the filter URL manually.
fields.summary: Exported csv filter file name will be default if the filter is updated with complex JQL
Rest call  to `/rest/api/3/search` should return issuekey/key field in expand sections

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When disabling the "Get email updates for issue activity" notifications on *personal settings*, you also disable the bell notifications, these two should not be related and you should still receive a bell notification when "X" user assigns an issue to "Y" user (you).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to personal settings
 # Disable the "Email updates for issue activity" notifications (watching, reporter, assignee, mentions, make changes to the issue)
 # Save the changes

h3. Expected Results
You should stop receiving email notifications but continue to see the bell notification in Jira when someone assigns a ticket to you or mentions you.

h3. Actual Results
You will stop receiving any kind of notifications either by email or in the bell notification icon when a user assigns an issue to you.
 
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabling email notifications also disables in-product notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the search for value for instance *text~"BugXXX-*", the search returns the ticket even though the value has been removed from the ticket. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create text custom field (fieldA), attach it to any screen to make it visible  (Text field single line is for sure affected, multi line may be as well)
# Create a ticket with and put some value to that field (fieldA), e.g: *BugXXX-*
# *Clear* the value for field (fieldA)
# Use JQL search {{text ~ "BugXXX-*"}} to search for the ticket.

Similar behaviour appears when {{fieldA ~ "BugXXX-*"}} is searched.

h3. Expected Results
The ticket shouldn't return from the search result.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket return from the search result.

h3. Workaround
Bug appears when field is cleared. Putting there any non-null value, e.g.  {{.}} causes the issue gone from search results
fields.summary: Search return ticket which contains a removed value.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user create an issue with attachment/image in the description field and use the format below .{noformat}!download.jpeg|width=100!{noformat}
Suddenly when someone edit the Description field from the new issue view, it automatically resize the image with height parameter and causing the image distorted at the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with adding an image in the "Description" field with the syntax below :-
{noformat}!download.jpeg|width=100!{noformat}
 # After the issue created , open the issue with new issue view template and edit the description field. For example add a text.
# Then, open the issue from the old issue view.

h3. Expected Results
The image remain the same.

h3. Actual Results
The image being resize to :-
{noformat}
!download.jpeg|width=100,height=183!
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing "Description" field from the new issue view , automatically resize the existing image in the field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a custom field is renamed from *secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa*, the change takes immediate effect on the UI and you can see this change from the Issue view. however via REST API changelog, the old name is retained. This causes a problem when trying to fetch the changelog of a custom field via API and the field cannot be found.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Rename a custom field.
 # Use the rest endpoint for changelog to check the custom name.
{code}
rest/api/3/issue/{issuekey}/changelog{code}
h3. Expected Results
The name changes reflected on the REST API endpoint. 
h3. Actual Results
The name doesn't reflect on the REST API endpoint. 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming of Custom field doesn't reflect the same name via REST API Changelog

fields.description: It would be great if you could support the 'Your work' page. Developers would being able to display objects in user context.
fields.summary: Support 'Your work' page
API for fetching project permissions is not giving accurate results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when a ticket is created from the mail handler and the ticket exceeds the limit of 32767 characters on the description field. The mail handler should either inform that the limit was reached or automatically trim and process the message.
fields.summary: Automatically trim description on tickets generated from an incoming mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When generating a Jira report, the box where the date and extra information should be is being shown as blank instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a report based on a board's issues.

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-08-03-10-44-23-966.png|width=558,height=284!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-08-03-10-41-41-432.png|width=554,height=281!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira reports showing blank box when hovering over it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing the Due Date field from the Epic Issue type in Next-gen projects, error received in German has translation bug

URL: [https://your_domain.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/FNG/boards/1/roadmap|https://atl-arawat.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/FNG/boards/1/roadmap]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the language to German
 # Go to any Next-gen projects
 # Click on Project Settings
 # Click on Epic Issue Type
 # Remove the Due Date field from Epic
 # Save Changes 
 # Click on Roadmap and you would receive below error

!image-2020-08-03-17-25-20-827.png|width=368,height=244!
h3. Expected Results
{noformat}
It should be 'Datenfelder hinzufügen'. {noformat}
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Instead it is Datuenfelder hinzufügen'{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: German Translation Bug in the Error when removing Due Date field from Epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening child issues by clicking on their *Summary* rather than the *Issue key*, the wrong issue is being displayed and any changes made would have actually been made on the parent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Story, Epic and Initiative together (Story > Epic link > Parent link)
 # On the Initiative issue details view, click on the *Summary* of its child issue(s)

h3. Expected Results

The child issue clicked on should open in the same tab and you should be viewing the issue detail view of that issue.

h3. Actual Results

The page will display the child issue you've clicked on but in reality, you're still on the parent and any changes made to the child will actually be saved on the parent.

You'll notice that the breadcrumbs show the Issue keys expected but the URL never changes.

 !_TST7-9__TEST_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

This can only happen in the new issue view and that's because in the old view the *Summary* is not clickable.

h3. Workaround

Open the child issues by clicking on the *Issue key* rather than the *Summary* of the issue.
fields.summary: Incorrect issue displayed when opening child issues
Web Link details not exported

fields.description: Similar to the long text field that is offered for the classic release versions. I would like a text field in which the user-facing release notes can be prepared.
fields.summary: Next-gen releases - add release notes field

fields.description:
For the time being, it's only possible to use square images to use as the project avatar following these requirements:

* A large avatar (48x48 pixels)
* A medium avatar (32x32 pixels).
* A small avatar (24x24 pixels)
* An extra-small avatar (16x16 pixels)

If you use a rectangle picture, it's not possible to resize it properly. It would be awesome to resize any kind of picture.
fields.summary: Resizing uploaded project avatar

fields.description: It will be great if there is a feature on the 'Manage filter' page, which allow user to bulk delete saved filters. Some user might have more than 100 or 1,000 saved filters, it takes too long to delete them one by one when it's not useful anymore.
fields.summary: Bulk delete filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a workflow scheme is associated with a project that has been moved to the trash bin an error is returned when trying to edit the scheme. Archived projects cause the same issue. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate a workflow scheme to a project
 # Move the project to the trash bin/archive a project
 # Try to edit the workflow scheme, for example try to add a workflow
 # The procedure gets stuck in the publish steps not being able to publish the changes and when clicking on cancel a token error is returned.
 !image-2020-07-17-15-48-00-713.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The workflow scheme should be able to be edited normally
h3. Actual Results

The publish steps get stuck and when cancel a token error is returned
h3. Workaround

The projects in the trash bin need to be restored or deleted so the scheme can be edited
fields.summary: Workflow scheme unable to be edited when an associated project is in the trash bin

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Sub-Task Blocking Condition displays all the statuses from the instance instead of just showing the ones involving the project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any workflow edit mode
# On diagram view, select a transition and click on conditions
# Click on add a condition and select "Sub-Task Blocking Condition"
# The list of available status will show but this list shows all the statuses from the instance
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Show the statuses involving the project

h3. Actual Results
The statuses from all the instance are displayed causing to be confusing on identifying the correct one

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Sub-Task Blocking Condition displays all the statuses from the instance

fields.description:
I would love to be able to directly create a new sprint from the Sprint field of the ticket if no Sprint are found from my search (the exact same comportement as the tag field works today) 

 

(pardon my english, not my native language)
fields.summary: Ability to create sprint from Create Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the *Reporter* field can be changed from Current User to any browsable user in the system. If you start entering a user that does not have Create Issues permission on that project, it still shows them.

The Old Issue View already works like this; if you try to type a user that does not have create issue permission, they do not show up.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Restrict the Create issue permissions to specific people
 # Compare Old and New issue view when you change the reporter, the list is different.

h3. Expected Results

The Reporters list should match with the "create issue permission".
h3. Actual Results

All users are listed.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Wrong Reporters list in New issue view

fields.description:
As a user I want a quick way to link issues without having to pull my hands from the keyboard, mouse over to a menu option and have to scroll through all the options to find "link issues." I want to be able to use a hotkey / keyboard shortcut to immediately access the functionality.

By comparison, I rarely if ever add a label, but I regularly link issue. Why would we have a hotkey for labels and not for links?
fields.summary: Add hotkey / keyboard shortcut for "link issue"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes, when a user uploads a file into the "file uploader manager" (screen-shot below) to post it into a comment/description of an issue using the new editor (New Issue View), the file is displayed as grey, with no name and the Save button is greyed out as well. Only after waiting for a long time the save button will be enabled and the file content will be loaded regardless of the file size. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

We suppose that this feature (file uploader manager) has been released with the purpose of making things simpler and easier for users to access their pre-uploaded files and manage them. Yet, this is actually doing the opposite for this particular scenario, if we consider that a simple drag and drop of a file into the comment section actually makes it upload it almost instantly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a file into an issue, comment section or description section using the file upload manager tool
 # Select the file to be added to the issue section
 # Insert it
_Note: this is an intermittent behavior so you might not be able to reproduce it at first_

h3. Expected Results
# File should load as fast as a simple drag an drop as it has been already pre-uploaded

h3. Actual Results
# File icon is grey with no name and size
# Save button is greyed out for a long time 
# It takes a long time to be able to upload a file regardless of its size

h3. Workaround
*Option 1:* simply drag an drop the file directly to the issue without using the file uploader manager
*Option 2:* disable Jira Labs from the personal settings of the user through the toggle button
fields.summary: Sometimes, it's slow to upload a file to a Jira issue using the file uploader manager

fields.description:
When creating a sub-task, it automatically inherits the security level of its parent. However, it is not possible to set the ("hidden") security level upon the creation of the sub-task. 
Inherits the security level of its parent make sense, *but* there is a lot of business cases that separate issue security for subtasks is applicable.
fields.summary: SubTask should have independent security levels

fields.description:
It creates confusion for standard subscription users because the option is visible and if they click on it, a better message should be displayed like "It's a premium feature". 

Hence I suggest the option to be visible only for the premium subscription and not for the standard license.
fields.summary: For standard license, the archive option shouldn't be visible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation for Jira is semi regularly receiving webhooks from Jira that contains invalid release dates. Two examples extracted from a webhook payload:

 
{code:java}
"versions": [
        {
          "self": "https://29022131.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/20443",
          "id": "20443",
          "name": "ios-3.25.0",
          "archived": false,
          "released": false,
          "releaseDate": "20201-12-12"
        }
      ],

...

"fixVersions": [
        {
          "self": "https://29022131.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/version/20443",
          "id": "20443",
          "name": "ios-3.25.0",
          "archived": false,
          "released": false,
          "releaseDate": "20201-12-12"
        }
      ],{code}
 
h3. Expected Results

The date to have a year that is in the form yyyy
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not sure how these dates are getting in.
h3. Actual Results

We cannot process this date and so the event isn't consumed and ignored. This could result in missed rule executions.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. Jira needs to correctly validate dates.
fields.summary: Jira is allowing invalid dates for release date of a Version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The right side panel from issue disappears when expanding a Tab created from Screen to the Project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Project that has Tabs added with other fields:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Open an issue and expand the Tab
 # Close the issue and reopen the same issue again

h3. Expected Results
The issue should show all fields and the right panel again
h3. Actual Results
The right side panel is no longer available until you refresh the page:
[^Bug_JRACLOUD-74877.webm]

h3. Workaround

Currently, the only workaround is to refresh the page and the right-side panel will be available
fields.summary: Right side panel from issue disappears when expanding a Tab created from Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The board or backlog view won't load in next gen projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to view a board or the backlog in a next gen project.

h3. Expected Results
The backlog or board view loads

h3. Actual Results
A generic error is returned.
!image-2020-07-29-14-45-00-716.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the Jira application logs:
{code} 2020-07-28 20:55:52.956 ERROR com.atlassian.jira.graphql.gira.GiraErrorLogging NullPointerException while fetching data java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueRestrictionSystemField.enrichDefaultValueForUi(IssueRestrictionSystemField.java:400) at java.util.Optional.flatMap(Optional.java:241) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueRestrictionSystemField.lambda$enrichDefaultValuesForUi$11(IssueRestrictionSystemField.java:394) at java.util.HashMap.forEach(HashMap.java:1289) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.IssueRestrictionSystemField.enrichDefaultValuesForUi(IssueRestrictionSystemField.java:394) at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.field.association.managment.SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.getEnrichedDefaultValuesForUiByFieldType(SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.java:203) at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.field.association.managment.SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.lambda$getEnrichedDefaultValuesForUi$19(SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.java:217) at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193) at java.util.HashMap$EntrySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1699) at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:482) at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:472) at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234) at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:577) at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.field.association.managment.SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.getEnrichedDefaultValuesForUi(SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.java:219) at com.atlassian.jira.simplified.field.association.managment.SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.enrichDefaultValuesForUi(SimplifiedFieldTypeAggregator.java:53)... {code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Boards and Backlog Fail to Load in Next Gen Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue statistic gadget is not working with custom user picker field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom user picker field.
# Add the field to the user creation screen.
# Create an issue and fill up the user picker field with value.
# Add the issue statistic gadget into a dashboard and set the user picker field as statistic type.


h3. Expected Results

The gadget should show the data based on the user picker field value.

h3. Actual Results

The gadget doesn't show data properly.

 !image-2020-07-29-23-08-32-055.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Issue statistic gadget is not working with custom user picker field

fields.description:
The document says that only stable versions are supported. Also, Firefox ESR doesn't work with Jira and confluence - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34353

It would be great if we have support for the ESR versions.

*Ref article* - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html]
fields.summary: Support for Firefox ESR versions for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Historical search on user on instance that has more than 100 users may fail with 
{quote}
The value 'ABC' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(non deterministic steps, depends what which users will CPUS return)

 # Have more than 100 users (CPUS default page)
 # Run JQL search to find all issues that user A was assigned to  (assuming ABC  is account id for user A) 
{code}
assignee was 'ABC'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Either issues are found or none depending on current system statt

h3. Actual Results
JQL reports a problem
{quote}
The value 'ABC' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Once https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74871 is resolved.

Assign and unassign any issue to user A. Although, it changes the state a bit, the problem appears only if affected user was never assignee of any issue.
fields.summary: Historic search on random users reports "does not exist for the field 'assignee'."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Historical search on user that does not exist anymore fails with message 
"The value 'ABC' does not exist for the field 'assignee'." 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user A and issue X
 # Assign user A to issue X 
 # Unassign user A from issue X 
 # Remove user A from Jira cloud (disable access for that user)
 # Run JQL search to find all issues that user A was assigned to  (assuming ABC  is account id for user A) 
{code}
assignee was 'ABC'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issue X is found

h3. Actual Results
JQL reports a problem
{quote}
The value 'ABC' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Historic search on user which does no longer exist fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an end-user, is set as project lead without _jira-administrator_ permission, when accessing Project settings, it doesn't display the Issue Types over the sidebar, above Issue Layout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic software project
# Set the user, without any _jira-administrator permission_ as Project Lead and set the Default Assignee as Project Lead
# Ask the user to access the project and go over Project settings

h3. Expected Results
When accessing the Project settings, over the sidebar, Issue Type should be displayed above Issue Layout. Even without access, the user should be able to visualize and access as per Permissions, Notifications, etc.

h3. Actual Results
The user doesn't see the Issue Types section over the sidebar, as the following screenshot.
 !issuetype bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only possible workaround is to add the user as a Jira administrator.

If we access the URL manually, (https://INSTANCEURL.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTID/issuetypes) the project lead is able to access but as read-only in the page, which would be expected since he's not a _jira-admin_, but still doesn't appear over the sidebar.
fields.summary: An end user set as Project Lead, doesn't see Issue Types in the sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using autocomplete on the "Invite your team" page fills all 3 fields with the same email address.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Set up a new Jira instance
 2. When you get to the "Invite your team" page, start typing an email you have used before in this browser (like <youraccountname>@ 
 3. The browser's autocomplete offers to fill in the rest of the email address
 4. Accept this autocompletion

h3. Expected Results
 - Only one field should be filled out

h3. Actual Results
 - All 3 fields are filled with the same email address

h3. Workaround
 - Let all fields fill out and delete the redundant ones
 - Don't use autocomplete
 
----
 *Starting to enter address*
 !image-2020-02-28-11-56-26-378.png|thumbnail!
 
----
*Rolling over autocomplete option*
 !_thumb_385124.png|thumbnail!

----
*Accepted autocomplete suggestion*
 !image-2020-02-28-11-56-47-874.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using autocomplete on the "Invite your team" page fills all 3 fields

fields.description:
Currently, when hovering over a username in the new issue view, a card pops up showing information for that user (e.g., their email address). It would be nice if a button was added to that pop-up/popup/card so that a user can click on it and it copies the email address of that user to the clipboard.

In the old issue view, it is at least possible to triple click on the email address and then copy it to the clipboard. This functionality or the aforementioned button is desired in the new issue view as well.
fields.summary: Ability to easily copy email address from user information card in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you set a date in the "Due date" field, the history shows a difference of one day in its records
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira classic project
 # Add an issue to the project
 # Edit the *Due date* of the created issue
 # Click on the *History* tab in the issue view

h3. Expected Results

The values of the "Due date" field and history are the same
h3. Actual Results

The history shows 1 less day in the entry.

!Screen Recording 2020-07-28 at 02.41.56 PM.gif|width=551,height=282!
h3. Workaround

This is only happening in the new issue view, the old issue view is showing the correct date
fields.summary: The history shows a difference of 1 day in changes made in the "Due date" field

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update - 12th October, 2020}
Hi everyone — since the introduction of Roadmaps across all Jira Software project types, the Epic Color field has become a critical field that key Jira features rely on. For this reason, we have made the decision to always show the Epic Color field on the new issue view and to close this ticket as "won't fix". As always, we welcome your feedback on this decision.

 

Cheers,

Pete Morris

Atlassian Product Manager
{panel}
 
 
 

 

It was implemented recently the possibility to change the Epic color via issue view, as described in the screenshot attached:

!Screen Shot 2020-07-28 at 12.42.10 PM.png|thumbnail!

As a Jira Software user, I want to control the visibility of this field, being able to hide it as it can be done to other fields (using screens or issue layout)
fields.summary: Ability to hide the Epic color field from the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As of now , if the user is not present in Trello , Trello importer does not show this while mapping users in Jira.
It would be good to have this feature where we can map issues which were raised by former users in Trello into Jira as former users.
fields.summary: Allow Trello import to import issues from former users in Trello to Jira .
Additional data in JSON payload while triggering webhook for issue link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Modifying the value in Settings -> System Setting -> General Configuration -> *Email From* is still using the old Jira email notification template.
 Reverting it back to the default value uses the new template.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Value in *Settings -> System Setting -> General Configuration ->* *Email From*
 # Create an issue and assign it to yourself.
 # Take a look at the Notification received.

h3. Expected Results

!image-2020-07-28-13-39-16-923.png|width=387,height=154!
h3. Actual Results

!image-2020-07-28-13-39-42-246.png|width=403,height=161!
h3. Workaround

Use the default *Email from* value *${fullname} (Jira)*.
h3. Notes:

We see the same behaviour if we change the outgoing mail address from default address to send emails on behalf of a custom domain under *Project settings > Notifications*.
fields.summary: Changing the "Email From" value in the General configuration uses the old email template.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Rarely happens, when we lookup for an issue, result JSON has field details but project details are not present. 

In the last 15 days we've noticed this on 2 issues for the same tenant.

This is problematic for apps (like Automation for Jira), as we are unable to continue rule execution.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Happened for tenant: 
 "tenantid": "07701a06-611b-300d-9df9-13ef44d91780"
 # Issue keys:
 "ITS-2205"
 "ITS-2886"
 # 200 from server, but project is not returned as part of issue field data:

{code:java}
July 21st 2020, 00:38:36.781 07701a06-611b-300d-9df9-13ef44d91780 5e795d95-e1dc-4118-abdd-320fb3870b87 INFO HttpClientImpl:143 GET 

https://mercadolibre.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/ITS-2886?<JWTMASKED> HTTP/1.1. Returned status [200]. Took: 13698ms.{code}

h3. Expected Results

Project data should be present in issue field data.
h3. Actual Results

There is no project = \{...} present inside the field section of the issue JSON.
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: When we lookup issue details, sometimes it has missing project details in the payload

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new navigation bar is showing the wrong last update from an issue when searching for it on Safari browser
The Created and updated date in the new issue view also shows "Invalid date" on the Safari browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Type an issue on the *Search* field

h3. Expected Results

It should show when the last update was performed:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!




h3. Actual Results

It shows an error message "Updated Invalid Date":
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

 !Screenshot 2021-05-14 at 13.01.14.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Workaround

Use a different browser *Chrome*
Sometimes updating Safari to 14.0.3 resolves the issue
 For the Safari browser currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New Navigation Bar - Search shows incorrect last update for issue searched - Safari

fields.description:
As a user, I don't think that showing the timeout message below on Automation for Jira field would be necessary. Especially because it looks glitched.

 !image-2020-07-27-14-02-40-321.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2020-07-27-14-01-58-429.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation - Fix session timed out

fields.description: Do not show a Removed user on JQL query
fields.summary: Do not show a Removed user on JQL query

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

While linking issues in new issue view, Advanced search option is not available
 * !image-2020-07-27-19-53-57-629.png|width=388,height=316!

While in old issue view, we can perform the search to filter the related issues and link multiple issues at the same time.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide Advanced search in issue linking in new issue view.
fields.summary: Advanced Search in issue linking is not available in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a user from the people page, the user avatar is empty from the auto-complete search result. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Project Settings* >*People*
 # Try to add a user to the people page
 # Noticed that the user avatar is empty. 

h3. Expected Results
The user avatar showing the profile picture of the user. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The user's avatar is empty. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding user to People page, the user avatar on the search result is empty.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Duplicate characters are entered when create comment with Japanese with Safari.
It doesn't looks to occur in other browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a issue with Safari browser
# Switch to Japanese IME and type "toukyou" in comment

h3. Expected Results
"とうきょう" is entered

h3. Actual Results
"tととうとうkとうkyとうきょとうきょうとうきょう" is entered
 [^画面収録 2020-07-27 9.51.59.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate characters are entered when create comment with Japanese with Safari

fields.description:
I would like the ability to wrap selected text with a code block in next-gen WYSIWYG editor. This already works for Action, Decision, Panel & Block quote.

Steps to reproduce:
- Paste code in Jira.
- Looks weird in plain text. Expected. Code always does.
- Highlight code.
- Click "code snippet".
- My code remains in plain text and now there is a new empty code block after it.
fields.summary: Add the ability to wrap selected text with a code block

fields.description:
There is currently only support for importing issues from CSV. This is problematic for two reasons:
 * Files cannot be human readable, as well as machine readable, limiting the use-case of CSV data to one use-case
 * A fix separator means that fields cannot contain that separator, or the import breaks

These problems cannot be addressed within the format of CSV. Hence, support form a bulk-create/issue-import from XML is needed.

Examples of bugs caused or related to the lack of an import from XML functionality: 
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1335
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68996
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66843
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62414
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64428
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64636
fields.summary: Support for Import issues from XML

fields.description:
At this moment, the preview for the excel file does not show any color of the cell if the cell has color added to it.

It would be great if we check the excel file colors cell with preview so that we can identify the file without downloading it again.
fields.summary: For excel file preview in attachment, does not show the cell color

fields.description: Labels Suggestion based on Global (all projects) or Per Project (suggest labels based on labels used on issues available on specific projects)
fields.summary: Labels Suggestion based on Global (all projects) or Per Project (suggest labels based on labels used on issues available on specific projects)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A particular user has the Edit Permissions option missing on his owned JIRA filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Impersonalize the filter owner 

#In the owned filter, clicking in the "Details", we don't see the "Edit permission" options enabled


h3. Expected Results

being able to see the "Edit permission" option at the owned filter

h3. Actual Results

User is not able to edit his own filter. After DEV investigation they concluded that the backend does not return an owner property for the fetched filters for a specific user.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page and you will be able to see the Edit option.
fields.summary: Edit Permissions option missing on owned JIRA filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
CSV Export should include "all related issues fields" - Linked issues (Inward or Outward)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link an issue to another from your project
 # Export the Issue where you linked the other one
h3. Expected Results
Display Inward and Outward linked issue fields
h3. Actual Results
It will only display Inward Linked issue

h3. Workaround

Use the *Open in Microsoft Excel* icon from the top right side:

 !image-2020-07-24-11-21-26-310.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: CSV Export should include "all related issues fields" - Linked issues (Inward or Outward)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating an issue via email handler, there is no option to set fields rather than the essential ones present in [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-779288896.html].

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to the mail handler to recognize fields settings from the body of the email.

h3. Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Ability to set extra fields when creating issues via email handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Referencing another saved filter in your JQL is not supported for the JQL search on scheduled actions despite validating the query if the filter share is restricted to a group Automation for Jira does not have access to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a saved filter in Jira
 # Create a rule using the *Scheduled* trigger 
 # In the JQL for the schedule, reference the saved filter (eg: filter in ("My saved filter")
 # Validate the query to make sure the JQL is valid and issues are being picked up
 !validate.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The rule is expected to run at the defined interval while initiating the defined action to the same issues found when validating the query previously.

h3. Actual Results

The rule will fail or simply not perform any changes to the issues that should be picked up by the referenced filter

{noformat}
Error running query for scheduled JQL trigger
{noformat}
 !Automation_rules_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The filter shares should be adjusted so the add-on user has access to it, otherwise, you should be using the raw JQL and not reference other filters.
fields.summary: Filter referencing not supported in JQL search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you add attachments like PDFs the system creates a break line/enter so a new line of text is available to click on and trigger the edit mode of the field.

If you access that field in the old issue view you can delete that line of text. If that space is deleted there is no way to trigger the edit mode and I think this is what happened in your case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add some attachments like PDFs to a text field like the description field in the Nex issue view
 # Go to the old issue view and delete all the spaces
 # Return to the New-issue view and try to edit the field

 [^Text field attachment BUG.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The edit mode will trigger in the field

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens


h3. Workaround

Add again any text line from the old issue view.
fields.summary: Text field not editable when having only attachments without spaces in New-issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I have created condition that will hide the transition to done status if the time tracking does not have time logged, this works with new created tickets and logging time to it, the problem happens when when you delete the logged time, the condition stops working and the transition keeps shwoing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a condition on a transition that checks if Time Spent is not empty
 # Create an issue and see that the transition is not displayed until you log time
 # Delete the logged time and see that the condition is no longer working
 [^Log time condition BUG.mov]

h3. Expected Results

When you delete the logged time the condition should hide the transition
h3. Actual Results

The transition keeps showing
h3. Workaround

Options:

a) Compare the Time Spent field as a Number instead of a String with a value > 0.

b) Use two conditions if comparing by a String. The first to make sure the value is empty, and the second to make sure the value is != '0'
fields.summary: Condition not working when logged time is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users that have both a licensed account and service desk customer account will not be able to create an issue via the global mail handler. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a mail handler

- Mail server : Default Cloud Mail Server (jira@yoursite.atlassian.net)
- Catch Email address : test@yoursite.atlassian.net
- Create an issue to Jira Software Project X

2. Add a new user as a service desk customer to a project. 

3. Add the same email address as a licensed Jira Software user that has the create issue permission on Jira Software Project X

4. As the user, send an email to jira@yoursite.atlassian.net (cc:test@yoursite.atlassian.net)

h3. Expected Results

An issue from the email should be created on Jira Software Project X

h3. Actual Results

The issue creation fails with a invalid license error.

{code}
WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler	Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]	
{code}

Migrating the JSD account to Atlassian Account also does not work for the email creation

{code}
WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.vertimail.VertimailPushMailHandler	Sender is anonymous, no default reporter specified and creating users is set to false (or external user management is enabled). Message rejected.

INFO	com.atlassian.mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.3	Reporter is found but inactive
{code}

h3. Workaround

1. Migrate the Service Desk account to an Atlassian Account. 
2. Delete the JSD account from admin (and re-add to a JSD project as a customer if needed)
3. Try to send an email again.
fields.summary: JSM Customers with Jira license are not able to create issues via global mail handler

fields.description:
*WHO*: Team lead / Product Owner overseeing development of the product.

*WHAT*: Ability to search by team using JQL.

*WHY*: It's inconvenient to search by listing all the members of the team within JQL query. On top of it, it might be different person defining who's member of the team and person who's actually using JQL.

 

*Notes*:
 * We use Cloud versions of Jira and Confluence.
 * To define teams, we use "https://<cloud_instance>.atlassian.net/people". 

*Workarounds:*
 * **Use groups:
 ** 
{code:java}
assignee in membersOf("group_name"){code}
fields.summary: Ability to search by team using JQL

fields.description: In Opsgenie, when Jira issues are linked/added to alerts/incidents there is no link back in Jira issues to find if issues are linked to Opsgenie.
fields.summary: Opsgenie link in Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing the issue type of an issue in the side-bar using the icon change method the flag notification will not vanish on subsequent issue loads

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load an issue in the side-bar (was able to repro with roadmaps, next gen & classic software)
# Change the issue type
# Select another issue
# Select that issue again

h3. Expected Results

The notification keeps appearing

h3. Actual Results

It only appears once and not on subsequent renders

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page as the visibility state of the flag is held in the browser.
fields.summary: Changing an issue type using the side-bar will show Issue type change on every render

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Windows OS, when setting the resolution to 1280 x 720 pixels and display settings set at 150%. 
Going to add attachment modal box, the modal box is aligned to the bottom which in turn excludes the 'insert' and 'cancel' button when selecting an image.

 !image (3).png|thumbnail! 
 !image (4).png|thumbnail! 
 !image (5).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Windows set the resolution to 1280 x 720 OR Set the scale and layout to 150%
 # Go to JIRA issue and add an attachment
 # Click on any image on recent uploads
 

h3. Expected Results
The 'insert' or 'cancel' button show up and the modal box is aligned to the center

h3. Actual Results
The button does not show up and the box is aligned to the bottom of page
 !image (4).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Zoom out the page or set the resolution to other than the resolution mentioned.
fields.summary: In Windows OS, unable to add attachment when scale and layout is set to 150% or resolution set to 1280 x 720

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, I need to be able to audit our email handlers. Please create a way for admins to extract email handler activity. In particular, we would need:
 * Email handler name
 * Count - the number of times the handler was processed during the log period
 * Last issue processed time stamp

I understand that you only keep a few weeks to a month of data in the log. Even a period that short could be useful if we could just run a report ourselves periodically.

The goal here is to retire email handlers that are not being used. When there are lots of handlers, and we use the default 1 minute period for checking them, we discovered that some of them can take a long time to process. I had to increase the interval time for all of them to make sure that they all were processed in an acceptable amount of time. Cleaning out unused email handlers would mean I could cut down the interval again. 

Thanks, 

John Wilson
fields.summary: Email handler log analysis tool, please

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a spreadsheet file with multiple columns
 # Attach the file to a Jira issue
 # Click on the attachment thumbnail to preview the file.

!print.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Jira will show a scrollable 'view-only' version of the spreadsheet, adjusting the layout (landscape/portrait) according to the spreadsheet's dimensions

!print2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Jira will currently cut columns to fit the page (portrait layout), adding the remaining information to a new page.

!print3.png|thumbnail!   !print4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve the format of spreadsheet files in attachment preview

fields.description:
Currently using the time spent field in a  validator makes mandatory to always log time in a transition, if the issue has currently logged time the validator doesn't consider it.

It would be very helpful that the validator is applied only if there is no logged time in the issue.
fields.summary: Be possible to create a validator that checks if time has been logged in the issue

fields.description:
Currently, the mobile app doesn't display either allow you to add web links to issues, while the feature is available in the web app.

As a Jira user, I want to be able to see and create web links in the mobile app.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to see and create web links in the mobile app

fields.description:
We would like to be able to see the story point of the tickets released in the release reports like on the screenshot attached

!scshs.png!
fields.summary: Story points in the release report in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [Please, add a corresponding suggestion here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74833].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Drop-down custom fields with long options are cut off in the create issue screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a drop-down custom field with long options(more than 40 characters).
# Create an issue and try to select the corresponding option.

h3. Expected Results
The drop-down has sufficient space to display the option.

h3. Actual Results
The drop-down option is cut off as the example below:
!Screen Shot 2020-07-22 at 10.42.25.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Drop down custom fields in Create Issue screen cuts off long options

fields.description:
When displaying the Jira issues Calendar, the last days from the previous month are displayed greyed out if you select the current month, as long as they are in the same week that the first days of the current month:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-21 at 16.25.11.png|width=300,height=173!

However, the issues related to the days of the previous month are not displayed when selecting the current month, so you must select the previous month to make it visible in the gadget:
!Screen Shot 2020-07-21 at 16.25.22.png|width=298,height=170!

It would be great if the issues could be displayed or the greyed out days too, without the need to switch it back to the previous month.
fields.summary: Display the issues from the previous month in the Jira issues Calendar gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation rules with *JQL Condition* that uses *withinCalendarHours() function* are returning *The following issues did not match the condition* even when they match the condition
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new rule:
 ** Trigger: Issue Created
 ** Condition: JQL: "SLA" != withinCalendarHours()
 ** *Any Action*
 # Create a new issue that matches the JQL used for the Condition

h3. Expected Results
The rule should run the actions when the issue matches the condition.

h3. Actual Results
The rule return *The following issues did not match the condition*

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Additional Information
SLA and Calendar:
 !SLA+Calendar.gif! 
Automation Rule JQL:
 !Automation JQL.png|thumbnail! 
Issue Created to match the condition:
 !Issue Created.png|thumbnail! 
Automation Rule ignoring the issue:
 !Automation Log_0.png|thumbnail!  !Automation Log_1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL Conditions using withinCalendarHours() function return "The following issues did not match the condition" even when they match the condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For the time being, when using a special germany letter as ß on an option of a custom field, the JQL is not returning any issue with that value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field
 # Create an option using the special letter ß
 # Create a dummy issue filling the field with that option (optional step)
 # Go to advanced search and use that option

h3. Expected Results
The search should show all issues containing that option in use for that field.

h3. Actual Results
The option '<value_option>' for field '<name_of_field>' does not exist.

h3. Workaround

The current workaround would be to rename the option using another letter instead of a special letter.
fields.summary: unable to use special germany letter on option field to search issues

fields.description: Availability to search by the first 3 letters you begin typing under User Management screen, regardless of the letters are at the end or at the beginning of the user name or email address.
fields.summary: Availability to search by the first 3 letters you begin typing under User Management screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When filtering issues using only the issue type filter on the Activity stream gadget is not showing any issue types, instead of is showing confluence updates not related to the issue type filtered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Activity stream gadget.
 # Filter your activities by the issue type filter. You can select any issue type for this filter, task, subtask
 # Check the results.

h3. Expected Results
The activities related to the issue type mentioned was shown.
h3. Actual Results
The activities related to the confluence were shown.

h3. Workaround

If you create a filter by project, in the Activity stream gadget, and after, create an issue type filter, the results will be shown correctly.
fields.summary: Filtering issues by issue type using the Activity stream gadget is bringing just confluence updates

fields.description:
When trying to Bulk select issues, it takes time for the entire page to load if there are more than 1000 issues. Before the page loads, if a customer tries to bulk select, then they are unable to select all instead they will be able to select only one at a time. Somtimes, have to click multiple times to select all.

Customer would like to have a progress bar for the successful loading of the page, so that once it is completed, then it allows the user to "select all" and perform further operations. This will help in case if there is any bad network connection.

Screenshots are attached when you try to select all before page loads and after page loads.
fields.summary: Show a progress bar/loading symbol or disable control to bulk select/move until the page completely loads

fields.description:
Whenever a user replies to a notification, images such as the view issue button, the favicon, and the Jira logo are all attached to the corresponding issue.

 

It would be nice if Atlassian was able to recognize that these images were originally generated from the system, and would prevent them from being added as an attachment.
fields.summary: Prevent Atlassian/JIRA images from being added as attachments when user responds to notification email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments are broken in new issue view inside the comments and description.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login into your Jira Cloud site.
 # Upload attachments to the issue description and comment.
 # Open the issue in new issue view and you will find those attachments broken inside comment and description.
# However you will still be able to see the attachments under the *Attachments* panel.

h3. Expected Results
Attachments should be visible in comments and descriptions inside Jira issues new issue view.

h3. Actual Results
* Attachments can be seen in the old issue view but not in the new issue view. 
* They can be seen inside a new issue view but under Attachments panel and broken under comments & description.

h3. Workaround
Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Broken attachments inside comments and description in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to identify roles with the same name from different next-gen projects when using the "Send Email" feature

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a site that has more than one next-gen projects
# Click the cog icon and select "Systems" > "Send Email"
# As "To", select "Project roles"

h3. Expected Results
* Roles are shown uniquely(no duplicates), or
* User is able to distinguish roles with same names from different projects

h3. Actual Results
Duplicated identical roles are shown for the following, according to the next-gen project type you have. Since the roles are shown in simple text, there is no way for the user to distinguish which role is the one that is related to the project they want to send the email for.
* Viewer
* Administrator
* Member
* Service Desk Customers
* Service Desk Team

In the following screenshot, two "Administrator" are shown.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-07-21 16.48.26.png|thumbnail!  

If you select the role that actually belongs to a different project, sending the email will fail.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to identify roles with the same name from different next-gen projects when using the "Send Email" feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By now, it's not possible to hide the Child Issues section from the View Screen:

!image-2020-07-20-19-12-29-548.png|width=639,height=339!
h3. Expected Results

it would be nice if this was possible to be customized, maybe by removing this from the View Screen.
h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to remove the Child Issues section from the View Screen.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Possibility to hide Child Issues section (from Advanced Road Maps) in the View Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating from Jira Server, Jira still preserves the users that remained on other user directories that are synced with Jira (such as AD or ay other), if any of those users, be assigned or the reporter of a ticket, it may break it and you won't be able to perform changes in the ticket, including changing the assignee to someone else.

* This scenario can only happen if you come from a *Jira Server Version*
* Whenever an issue is assigned to an 'unknown user' it'll look like this:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Identify an issue assigned to an unknown user (example below)
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
2. Attempt to change the assignee or reporter of the ticket

h3. Expected Results
Jira will still allow you to operate changes on the issue, as this "unknown user" scenario is expected as Jira doesn't migrate users from different directories automatically (see JRACLOUD-71339)


h3. Actual Results
The issue is broken and can no longer be changed or have those fields fixed

* The following call will fail and can be seen in the *Network Tab*
{code}
*Endpoint*: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/ABC-123/assignee
*Status*: 400 (Bad request)
Response: {"errorMessages":["We couldn't save ABC-123. Copy your content, then try reloading the issue."],"errors":{}}
{code}



h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. If you have the same symptoms on your instance, contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Cannot change assignee/reporter if the user is an 'unknown user' from a server import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira menu doesn't show any option when accessing the projects' trash
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira
 # Access *Jira settings > Projects > Trash* or *Jira settings > Projects > Archive*

h3. Expected Results

The page loads completely and the options in the menu are displayed
h3. Actual Results

The menu doesn't display any option

!Screen Shot 2020-07-20 at 4.16.52 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Users can visit the URL directly to view the archive/trash projects.

URL for archive: \{domain}/jira/settings/projects/archive

URL for trash: \{domain}/jira/settings/projects/trash
fields.summary: The Jira menu isn't loading when accessing the projects' trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to update a filter that is shared with a project that was moved to trash, the following error is show:
{code:java}
The filter [NAME OF THE FILTER] could not be saved.{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a testing filter
 # Share this with two or more projects
 # Move one of the projects to trash
 # Change a detail in the testing filter and try to save it
 # You won't be able to save the filter

h3. Expected Results

The updating process should be possible or a clearer error message should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to save any changes on the filter and the following error message is shown:

!image-2020-07-20-15-52-08-676.png|width=683,height=83!

When trying to Save the changes, a 400 error is thrown and the following message is found as response:
{code:java}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"shares":"Selected project does not exist."}}{code}
h3. Workaround

To fix this, it's possible to remove the project that was moved to trash from the ones to which the filter is shared with. To do this, click on "Details" and then on "X" to remove the project from the filter - please note that its name will not appear on the screen:

!image-2020-07-20-15-54-00-555.png|width=227,height=172!
fields.summary: Not possible to update a filter if this is shared with a project that was moved to trash

fields.description:
Currently the supported operators for the 'sprint' field are: 
=, !=, >, >=, <, <= ,IS ,IS NOT ,IN and NOT IN

An improvement would be to allow historical searches 
WAS & WAS NOT

To allow a user to query when new issues were added to a sprint:
example: 
{code}sprint = x AND Sprint WAS NOT x ON "dd/mm/yyyy"{code}
fields.summary: Allow historical search operators (was, was not) for the 'sprint' field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Select list* custom field can cause performance issues in the Issue detail view when exceeding a certain amount of option values.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom *Select list* type field (multi-choice was used during testing)
 # Add over 10000 option values to the field

h3. Expected Results

When editing this field on the Issue detail view it should behave normally.

h3. Actual Results

The field becomes unresponsive when editing and in some cases freeze or crash your browser.

 !2020-07-20_17-21-59.gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

It is recommended to split the options into multiple *Select list* custom fields to reduce the load on the page.
fields.summary: Select list custom field becomes unresponsive with too many options

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira, the sidebar active area is too wide/overlaps other elements and this prevents users to work on a few elements.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the add-on T4J
# Navigate to a project > Project settings > Test Management > Enable Test Management for Jira > Add yourself to all the permissions listed
# Navigate back to the project > Tests > Create a Test cycle and a few Test cases
# Open the Test cycle created and the try to enable/disable the option *Show only assigned to me*

h3. Expected Result
The checkbox Show only assigned to me should be active

h3. Actual Result
The checkbox is overlapped by the Jira sidebar 

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to click on the text *Show only assigned to me* to enable/disable the option
fields.summary: Jira sidebar active area is wide and it prevents interaction of some elements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Once you set a value for a Text Field multi-line (custom or default of Jira) like the description and remove that, Jira's JQL will not recognize that field as EMPTY anymore.

Also, the Jira expression would return "true" for text validation even if the field is Empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue (Classic or Next-gen) with the description field empty
# Search it using JQL (this will work (/)):
#* {code}
issuekey="EXAMPLE-1" and description is EMPTY
{code}
# Set something on the description field and save it
# Remove the text from it and run the same JQL again (will not bring that issue anymore (x))

h3. Expected Results
The field should be considered as empty again since no information is set.

This is how the field is shown on Jira (REST API) if the issue was created without any value on it.
 !image-2020-07-17-19-50-35-209.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The JQL doesn't recognize that field as 

This is how the field is shown on Jira (REST API) if some value was set and unset from it.
 !image-2020-07-17-19-51-31-014.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL "is EMPTY" doesn't work for Text Field that was cleared

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This behavior looks similar to a previous bug that was closed as not reproducible at the time of initial investigation:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-70029

The behavior occurs In Google Chrome on 1080P monitor when browser zoom is set to 110% in this case opposed to 100% zoom in the previous case this appears to be hardware dependent as well as this cannot be reproduced on a retina display, additional details in Notes section below.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud 
* Chrome versions tested:
** Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)
** Version 84.0.4147.89 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Monitor Dell U2414H at 1080p 1920 x 1080 resolution at 60 Hz

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On 1080p Monitor (cannot reproduce on retina display)
# Set browser zoom level to 110%
# Click a drop down menu

h3. Expected Results
Text is clear

h3. Actual Results
Text is blurry and distorted
 
h3. Notes
This appears to be hardware dependent for reproduction steps,  I cannot reproduce on a retina display but using the same system with a external monitor model U2414H at 1080p 1920 x 1080 at 60 Hz the blurry text occurs at 110% zoom.

Previous case was not able to reproduce which could possibly be related monitor hardware where the tested was performed, and a pixel smoothing architecture to half pixel transform opperations on text scaling as described [here|https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/23590] Which would be impacted by monitor specs, so the error will vary by zoom level Between different monitor hardware used, affected by resolution scaling for higher and lower pixel density.

h3.Workaround
There is not workaround at the faulting zoom level so Zooming in or out until the text is clear is the only current option
fields.summary: Dropdown menu fonts becomes blurry when zoom-in ratio on browser increases to 110%

fields.description: Show a DELETE option in the Gsuite Managed users screen and not only the Deactivate option
fields.summary: Show a DELETE option in the Gsuite

fields.description: Show more information on the Audit Log when you get an error message Manual Syncing Gsuite
fields.summary: Show more information on the Audit Log when you get an error message Manual Syncing Gsuite

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when Jira sends a notification e-mail, the name of the author/ modifier is included in the "From" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove this field, leaving just the instance's name.
fields.summary: Remove names from the "from" field on e-mail notifications

fields.description:
We would like to only see *Sum of Original estimates* in the Backlog view when we add *Σ Original Estimate* in the *Card layout* under the *Backlog*.

Current Behaviour: -
It shows both *Original Estimate* and *Sum of Original estimates* in the Backlog when estimation statistics is set to *Original time Estimate*.

Workaround: - No workaround, as we do not have any setting to tweak this feature.
fields.summary: Replace Original Estimate with Summation of Original estimates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to Connect Jira instance to Slack integration
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your Slack channel and use the */jira connect* command
 # Select your *Jira Site* you would like to connect

h3. Expected Results
Once the Jira Site is selected you will be able to select the Project that you would like to use
h3. Actual Results
You will receive an error message from the Slack channel:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Connect Jira instance to Slack integration

fields.description:
I use project category a lot.  Not all plugins support it.  Many people are unaware of it because it has low visibility in the UI.  I use it all the time.  *I wish that projects could be assigned to multiple categories - similar to issues can be assigned to multiple components.*   My goal is to simplify filter maintenance on dashboards and agile boards.  Being able to select a set of projects by category is simple.  If a new projects comes into scope all I have to do is add it to the category.

If I have a dashboard with 5 gadgets and 5 different filters or views, I can change sets of filters by adding and removing projects from categories.

I use categories to group by types of workflow or types of release (cadence, target). It depends on the requirements of the organization.
fields.summary: Make Project Category more visible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The priority color can not be updated by clicking the color chart anymore, making customers update this field by writing the color name and creating an inconsistency in the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Priorities https://<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
# Edit or Create a priority color
# Try to click in the color chart

h3. Expected Results
The color chart  opens so you can select the color you want to use

h3. Actual Results
You can't click the color chart
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-16 at 13.34.05.png|thumbnail! 

As a side note, it's very likely customers will try to 'write' the color name, although our [doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-statuses-resolutions-and-priorities-776636333.html] says to use HTML color code or color chart. This will create an inconsistency in the database and will break JSW boards, for example.

{code}
Returning internal server error in response
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "Black"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:580)
	at java.lang.Integer.valueOf(Integer.java:740)
	at java.lang.Integer.decode(Integer.java:1197)
	at java.awt.Color.decode(Color.java:729)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.view.color.CardColorPalette.getDefaultColorForPriority(CardColorPalette.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.view.color.CardColorQueryServiceImpl.createMissingColorForPriorityStrategy(CardColorQueryServiceImpl.java:270)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.view.color.CardColorQueryServiceImpl.lambda$createMissingColorForGivenStrategy$5(CardColorQueryServiceImpl.java:249)
{code}

h3. Workaround
- Set a priority color with the HTML color code or use the clickable area:
 !clickable area.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Priority Color can not be updated by clicking the color chart

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way of an admin disable all kind of notification for an specific email address.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an option for the org admin disable notifications for an user email. For example: Invite request.
fields.summary: Allow admin disable email notification for users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Story Point wraps in the next line of the issue. So basically we would like to see the *Story Point* in the extreme right near to the Priority field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * This is only happening to *Kanban* Board. 
 * We add *Story Points* field in the Backlog in the *Card layout* section from Board settings.
 * When we come back to the *Backlog*, we can see the *Story Point* comes on to the next line of the issue instead of all the field showing in just one single line.
 * This does not happen in *Scrum Board* because there is *Estimation* option in the Card layout and when we select *Story points* as estimation value and made sure we have not added *Story points* in the *Card layout*, unlike Kanban Board settings.


h3. Expected Results

Below you can see that the *Story point* is at the extreme right in *Scrum Board*
  !image-2020-07-16-21-33-42-402.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
You can see below *Story Point* comes on to the next line of the issue instead of all the field showing in just one single line in *Kanban Board*
 !image-2020-07-16-21-33-56-648.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround. Just to add one more thing here, *Story points* getting wrapped up to another line is not because of *Issue Summary* length. Even with just a short issue summary also does the same (as you can see in the image).
fields.summary: Story Points wraps up to next line.
